intro: Ritterocereus standleyi, commonly known as the Santa Rita night bloomer, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with smooth, green stems that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces large, fragrant white flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as bats and moths. Its flowers are typically followed by red, fleshy fruits that are edible and contain seeds. Ritterocereus standleyi is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water.
